intro: Pimenta acris var. grisea, commonly known as the gray pimento, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and leathery, grayish-green leaves. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. This variety is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and ornamental value in gardens.
